Key Match Events: Karl-Anthony Towns delivered a monster double-double with 27 points and 13 rebounds to lead the Knicks to a 112-98 victory over the Raptors.
Josh Hart finished three assists shy of a triple-double with 21 points, 11 rebounds, and seven assists.
OG Anunoby tied Towns with a game-high 27 points against his former team.
Pre-Game Insights: Karl-Anthony Towns was questionable to play due to patellar tendinopathy in his right knee but decided to play with Patrick Ewing in attendance.
The Knicks aimed to snap their season-worst three-game losing streak.
Post-Match Reflections: Karl-Anthony Towns expressed his admiration for Patrick Ewing, calling it a humbling experience to play in front of him.
Coach Tom Thibodeau emphasized the importance of continuous improvement and learning from each game.
Thibodeau expressed confidence in his team's ability to meet challenges despite recent struggles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Patrick Ewing, the best center in Knicks franchise history, was in attendance.
The Knicks improved to a 25-13 record, the third-best in the East.
